entries.meaning: (informal) The sound of underwater bubbles, or of water bubbling (often used repetitively).
examples: The boat, which was filled with water, instantly—glub, glub—sank.

verbs.description: glub (third-person singular simple present glubs, present participle glubbing, simple past and past participle glubbed)

entries.meaning: (informal) To make a sound like underwater bubbling; to glug.
